h1: How Many Calories Are in a Poke Bowl?
assumptions: Standard poke bowl: 1 cup cooked white rice, 4 oz raw ahi tuna, mixed greens/veggies (cucumber, edamame), 1/4 avocado, sesame seeds, soy-based sauce; no extras like fried toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion sizes, fish type, sauce, and restaurant recipe. Check labels or apps for custom bowls.

quick_answer.text: A typical poke bowl contains about 520 kcal with balanced protein from fish and carbs from rice.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Substitute rice with cauliflower rice base
Add 1 tbsp extra soy sauce and sesame oil
Double the fish portion (to 8 oz tuna)

faqs.q: How many calories is in a poke bowl with salmon?
faqs.a: Similar to tuna, about 550 kcal; salmon adds healthy fats but slightly more calories.
Depends on baseâ€”rice version has ~55 g carbs; opt for greens or cauliflower rice for under 20 g.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a standard poke bowl?
faqs.a: Around 32 g, mainly from the fish like ahi tuna or tofu alternative.

faqs.q: How does sauce affect calories in a poke bowl?
faqs.a: Soy or spicy mayo can add 50-100 kcal; choose light versions to keep totals under 500 kcal.

faqs.q: Is a poke bowl healthy despite the calories?
faqs.a: Yes, it's nutrient-dense with omega-3s, veggies, and fiber, but watch sodium from sauces.
